subject: Re: @BeforeClass vs. TestCase's constructor?
msgSnippet: Hi.  I see!  Thanks for clearing that up! That being said, is there a time I should use the test case s constructor instead of @Before? Thanks again, Ken ...
messageBody:
Hi. I see! Thanks for clearing that up!

That being said, is there a time I should use the test case's constructor instead of @Before?

Thanks again,

Ken

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> @BeforeClass runs only once ever, whereas the constructor runs once
> per test method. Does that help?
>
> David
<snip>
